reviewText:
This 'game' is created by Jason Welge, someone who is well known by the Kickstarter and Unreal development community as a fraud.

Lets look shall we? The sixth post down is Jason welge, details of his fraud in gaining assets created for this 'game' are given in detail:
https://forums.unrealengine.com/showthread.php?31395-Scam-Reports-amp-Tips&highlight=Jason+welge

We then have his criminal conviction of Grand Theft Property (more than $300 but less than $5000): http://openpasts.com/PublicRecord/JASON-WELGE/1301215733989

With his Kickstarter attempts listed here:
https://www.kickstarter.com/profile/7547109/created

It is rumoured the kickstarters were a means of gaining legal fees, this however, isn't fact, but the timing is very 'unfortunate' as pointed out here: https://twitter.com/BroTeamPill/status/549991041420783617

A great collection of photos by Bro Team Pill demonstrating how Jasons loves deceit and thinks everyone can be fooled by words that come out of his mouth: https://twitter.com/broteampill/status/550183967048355841

A lot of good links here too:
http://www.reddit.com/r/KotakuInAction/comments/2qwk5e/creator_of_4_failed_kickstarter_campaigns_starts/

But what does all this have to do with the game? Well simple, the game is as bad as his reputation, enemies spawn 2 feet away from you, the animations and 'game feel' just don't exist and it is obvious Jason has no knowledge of game design whatsoever.

I say this a lot but never have I meant this with such passion. It's the worst attempt at a game I have ever played. A great video by 'Jim Sterling' demonstrates this:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uqFSNEKOlwg
Along with 'Unit Lost':
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AdJWhIrxyU4
Neither are being bad just for the video either (notice how they both get to the same point and no further), the 'game' is actually that 'difficult' to play, as mentioned earlier, enemies follow no set rules, they just do what they feel like and the players sense of direction just doesn't exist, you have no idea of what to do or where to go.

The forums are full of censorship too, try bring up anything negative and it will be deleted and you yourself, banned. Luckily I expected this and archived the posts before they were deleted, look for yourself and make your own mind up as to whether he was right or wrong to delete these threads:

Early Access Review

When I start up this game, I see a really blurry picture of a guy who looks like Gordon Freeman holding a hatchet.  Then when I press start I'm dropped into the middle of some sort of desert/forest/lake area.  There's a short loop of a wind sound playing.  My character is holding his hand out like he's got a gun, but he doesn't.  There's a flashlight shining magically in front of me from out of nowhere.  As I clumsily climb a nearby hill through an obscene amount of motion blur I see a building in the distance but assume it's part of a flat skybox graphic because the depth of field is horrible and everything is deliberately out of focus.  As I head towards it I realize it is actually real.  I hear a weird noise as I cross a lake, then notice spider arms to the left and right of the screen as my life meter slowly drops.  I turn around but keep running backwards.  I see a giant...thing.  Maybe a spider?  Or a crayfish?  Can't be sure, but eventually it quits trying to softly hug me to death and runs away sideways for no reason at all.  After a long boring walk, I finally make it to the buildings.  I find a gun, and after much frustration realize I can pick it up by pressing E on my keyboard (no button on my Xbox 360 controller will do it).  A moment later everything freezes for a few seconds while the game loads up some music and an army of identical black zombies in orange jumpsuits.  As they slide unnaturally around the stage I shoot them and they begin to flop all over the place, stretching and morphing like blobs of silly putty.  Sometimes another spider-crayfish shows up and tries to hug me some more.  Sometimes one will shoot a fireball the size of a truck at me, and my graphics suddenly choke so bad I beg for the slip-sliding army of incompetent zombie clones and spider-crayfish to end my life.  Finally it happens and I quit.

I do not understand what I've just experienced.  I got this game for free in some bundle, but somehow I still feel ripped off.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8d4RtvMQp10

This. So much this. Imagine the martians are PanzerGamingStudios and the computer is Unreal 4 and you have a clear idea of what's going on here.

Read ahead if you like, but you shouldn't have to. It's that bad.

Furthermore, on account of the fact that the developer's page doesn't have any emblems or information about their label, a link to website, anything to indicate that it's Panzer Gaming Studios other than the name panzergamingstudios, I don't trust them. I trust them less because the Store page shows some screenshots that are from the Unreal Engine 4 editor, not from the game.

EDIT: PanzerGamingStudios clearly has never heard of the Streisand Effect, as his attempts to delete, ban, lock and otherwise suppress the DELUGE of negative press has only succeeded in... well... generating even more damning negative press.


The glaring issues with the game are as follows;
-It is NOT FUN.

-No 64 bit mode, which may help it's framerate some.

-No Steamworks integration. Collector's cards work, but that's about it. You cannot take screenshots or access the overlay from within the game, on account of a DOS-based go-between program to launch the game. Nor does Print Screen take screen captures. It only captures a black screen. You literally need to have a very good third party video or screenshot application to be able to take ANYTHING you see in the game out of it.

-Abysmal optimisation. Even on powerful current gen hardware the game lags horribly. The scripted in-engine introduction sequence has a framerate around 10FPS.

-Even with it's horrid framerate, it is ugly as sin. You'd think that a game that drags your framerate down into the 10-20 range would be approaching photorealism, but this game is just... there are better looking games in Unreal 2. This game is built in Unreal 4. Just... yeah.

-Mouselook arbitrarily stops responding for 1-3 seconds at a time.

-Horrible screen and texture tearing.

-The camera sometimes floats 'inside' the character, so you're looking through their arm.

-Nonsensical writing. It might make more sense if a paranoid schitzophrenic had written it.

-Braindead AI. The developer has attempted to hide the fact that the AI is beyond stupid by giving them way too much HP and hit way too hard, giving them game sort of artificial difficulty. The enemies are still as dumb as a bag of hammers and COULD be kited indefinitely. EDIT: You do not even need to fight the enemies. You can simply run past them to get to the next level.

-Broken maps, repetative and unimaginative set pieces.

-Special effects so bright as to be blinding.

-The game is constantly changing. And by changing I don't mean mechanical tweaks, extra mobs, balancing, etc. The very layout of the game changes, as well as the combat system. It does not seem like the developer has any idea what they want the game to be.

-The game locks up without warning to load. The developer informed me that this is a flaw in the design of all iterations of Unreal, but that there are ways to make it less glaring. None of which are being implemented. To be honest, with the exception of Space Marine I can't ever recall a video game built in Unreal locking up without warning to load the next area.

-The music, while upbeat, is repetative and at times downright irritating to the point I mute the game.

-Other sound effects are derivative, possibly even stock Unreal assets and annoying.

-Broken magic system. Seriously, the game's unskippable introduction explains the magic system, but magic right now is completely unusable.

-The single instance of voice acting in the game is terribly done. He might have been able to record better audio with a camcorder or iPhone. No really. It's THAT bad. You can even hear the mouse click when he began recording. That's how few f*cks he gave about it.

-The one NPC in the game barely moves, and during the horrid voice acting his face does not even move, nevermind have any kind of lip syncing.

-I'm pretty sure that the monster at the beginning of the game is directly ripped off from DOOM. (Hell Knight and Cyberdemon look EXTREMELY familiar, eh?)


TL;DR - Calling this game Alpha build is a total lie. On account of it's handful of working maps that are constantly changing in design and layout, combat system in a constant state of being reworked, and overall being unplayable I would be extremely hard pressed to say that it is past pre-alpha, maybe even still in preproduction. It may have, at one point been a decent game when it was in UDK. But since having been rebuilt completely from the ground up in UE4, it's a disaster. This game does not belong on Steam.

Also;

Awards
1st Place Winner for Best Indie Game at Whitewater MAGD Awards (2013)
2nd Place Winner for Best Indie Game at Whitewater MAGD Awards (2012)

I recant my initial statement about this. Instead I submit that it is a complete lie.
http://i.imgur.com/BgTDLZq.png
This thread has since been deleted by the developer. An action that both proves my point in the reply, and compounds my lack of faith in him and his project.
The developer himself admits that the game that recieved these awards was A New Reckoning - UDK. This is A New Reckoning - UE4, a new game started completely from scratch in a new engine, unrecognizable compared to the game demo'd in Whitewater MAGD 2012 and 2013.

Featured in the Hollywood film festival indie movie of the year 2102 Starlet.

This is again a total lie, but it can't go overlooked that this developer is so unprofessional and careless that he doesn't even PROOFREAD or SPELLCHECK anything he says or does. How does this evade him? 2102 (Should be 2012) has been incorrect for days, maybe a week or more. I can't say I noticed when it went up, just that it's been there for several days and still lacks proofreading. (facepalm)

Its rare when I get to review a game five times in the span of two years, but Time Ramesside continues to be one the most absurd oddity I've ever come across. Time Ramesside is a horrible first person shooter first and foremost, but each and every iteration is different. Every update has a new start level and after spending more than twelve hours in the game and making extensive bug reports to the developers, I've still never once completed any of the dozen first levels that I've played.

This version is completely different than the last version I played two months ago. The game has been completed and finished for half a year now, but it continues to be worked on. Time Ramesside has gotten better yes, but for every step forward it takes a huge leap back and breaks its legs. Now that the game is finished its been announced this was only the first episode. I have a feeling that's their way of cutting the game into thirds without finishing it.

The last version I played started me off with an extremely long cut scene after another cut scene and on top of that was another cut scene. My player fell out of a small prison bus and made his way into a prison dodging cameras that would close the doors if he was spotted. Its odd that trying to get into a prison would close giant gates, but whatever. Why question the logic? The structures hovered above ground, but nothing was as bad as the spawning arachnids that could kill the player easy and spawn in right on top of him.

Oh but this current update has you in front of a prison on a bridge, but now its a warmer setting. The ground is covered with shallow pools of water and there is grass overtaking everything. Its abandon except for the flesh less zombies inside.the yard. These zombies spawn in mid air on top of one another so one can be hovering over a cluster of other zombies. This is nothing new. The animations look strange and stiff, but I suppose its better than the T pose they originally had.

That's one of the downfalls of releasing a game too early to the public. We get a chance to remember and sour future reviews. The developers would listen to constructive feedback and act like they'd do something about it, but at the end of the day when they put resolved" on a bug in the forum it was never resolved so much as acknowledged yes this is a bug.

The controls are awful. Rather than typical strafe with the left and right

I would give this a 0/10 but I feel it deserves a -5/10.   It's early access, yes, but this is ludicrous.  This shouldn't have been eligible for early access in this state.

I got this game in a bundle so I'm not too upset, but for those of you looking at this game just walk away.

The graphics are from 2002, the voice acting is terrible and you can tell it's some guy on a webcam mic(you can even hear his mouse clicking to read the next page of text)  The animations and cutscenes are dreadful, gameplay is a joke and overall this is worth nothing.  The controls are absolutely horrid and a lot of keys are, by default, double-mapped(so Q has 3 functions every time you push it) and the camera effects are amateur to the point of being offensive.   The music sucks too.

The gameplay is a first person shooter mixed with spell casting, something we've been seeing in Half Life mods since the early 2000s, and it almost rips off doom, this is tired and there is no fun or innovation, or even a nostalgia factor, it's just bad.  The level designs are bad and this game is so badly optimized you will fight the lag to even play.

The only good point I have is that I haven't found any bugs(lag aside), but I'm not going to play this mess for long so if you play for more than 30 or 40 minutes then I would expect a handful of bugs, at least.

Maybe once they get more into development they'll add facial animations and proper voice acting, but THIS is not something that will bring a good mark of faith, there is literally no fun to be had and I doubt anyone would get behind this 'thing'.

Just stay away.  If someone tries to give this game to you say 'no' because you don't need this ♥♥♥♥ cluttering up your gaming collection.

This is abysmal.  Steam please regulate your Early Access titles a little more, people are being ripped off left and right.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I do not like this game.  I've tried, but something is wrong when the tutorial level has enemies with WAY too much health.  A tutorial level should help the player get adjusted to the game, and, in a sense, I suppose ANR's (A New Reckoning) tutorial level is no different.  You start by phasing through a bus door, the bus is surrounded by police cars, (which are not to appropriate scale to the character), and are greeted by floating text blocks which give you a run down how to select the 'teleport' spell and use it.  As of this writing, the UI is little more than text (I hope they get a rudimentary iconic UI up soon, as the text is dull and quite ugly, maybe a spell selection wheel with spells that are not available grey'd out.)

After learning to teleport, you are invited into a building that opens the way to the rest of the map.  It is largely a walking simulator at this point, where you can marvel at indoor street lamps (the kind you see on the streets, generally not indoors), snow on the floor (though it has no way to get there), and some bushes curiously growing out of the snow.  After teleporting to the other side of a fence, I am attacked by a demon-thingy.  Simple affair, bullets, death, move on.

After destroying the demon dog thingy, I am then accosted by a flaming spider of significant size.  As I fight it, it poops out smaller, not flaming spiders every time it teleports near me.  If you ignore the smaller spiders, they become a life syphon, and eat all your health.  I found myself unloading an entire clip just to get rid of one of the spiders.  Circle strafing and typical FPS skills don't count here, as the baby spiders stick to you like glue.  I died.  Quick.

Trying again, I teleported up to the rafters in the building, so while the baby spiders couldn't reach me, I couldn't get any health pickups, and quickly ran out of ammo and spell juice.  I lobbed a couple fireballs at them, taking down two or three at a time, only to have flaming titan spider pop back next to me and poop out more.  I dropped back to the ground, and picked up the health pickups, and ammo, and was swarmed.  I died.  Again.  On a tutorial level.  No matter HOW GOOd or BAD a player is, they should NEVER fail on a tutorial level.  And if they do fail, they should be allowed to try whatever they are trying to do again, without having to be dropped back to the intro screen, or text, or whatever.

Right now, the game plays like a bare bones Unreal game, without, well, the fun.  If you are thinking about getting this game, I would suggest not, but if you do, at least wait until:

1.)  It's closer to completion
2.)  It's on sale for really, really, really cheap
or
3.)  Know what you are getting yourself into.

It's not good, even for early access, not at this point, anyway.  And believe me, I am a huge Early Access supporter.  I have many Early Access titles.  The congative dissonance I've witnessed from the developer in the forums (like those who do not like the game being called trolls") is another turn off for me

reviewText:
*I did not pay for this game. I got it free through a give away.*

This is a re-review after 2 major updates. I just wanted to do this out of fairness. This review contains spoilers. So here we go:

This game is not even remotely what it used to be. In fact it now looks like it's trying to be a horror game. Everything is different for the most part and the only way to talk about this game is by level.

Level 1 - Introduction
This is basically a level where you fight a bunch of monsters while the credits go by. You're trapped in a prison with a bunch of monsters and a little girl.
Pros
-Great atmosphere.
Cons
-The flashlight is located behind your machine gun causing a ton of glare on the front sight.
-It's confusing as what you're supposed to do.
-Shooting monsters is not fun as they don't hurt you, can trap you, and their death animation restarts every time you shoot them causing you to waste a ton of ammo.
-The little girl has no point and you can clip through her.

Level 2 - Prison Level
Here you start 10 minutes before the introduction. It's like the intro but now you aren't trapped.
Pros
-Great atmosphere again
-There's a story.
-There's decent voice work.
Cons
-There's no reason to shoot anything and you can run past everything.
-Shooting stuff still isn't fun.
-There's a hallway that looks spooky but when you go down it you realize it's actually a missing wall that takes you outside of the map.
-Doors are broken. If you go up to a door and it opens go through it because if it closes you're never opening it up again.
-Nothing is scary as the jump scares are cartoony compared to the rest of the environment, not sudden, and too far away.
-It ends abruptly in a confusing way.

Level 3 - Outside city area
You're now outside on the city streets. I'm assuming because you escaped the prison even though it's not entirely clear.
Pros
-Impressive variety of new monsters that, even though they're stock, fit quite well.
-Lighting is nice and you can see where you're going.
-Ammo is available on the ground.
-There's a cool looking boss at the end.
Cons
-Again there's no point to shooting things and there's no reason to anyway since it's way too open.
-Because of the above this level is extremely boring.
-There's no point to the boss fight as you can run past and end the level.

Level 4 - Condemned building
This time you're in an abandoned building. This is by far the best level in the game.
Pros
-Excellent atmosphere
-The hallway is narrower so you have a reason to shoot things.
-There are open rooms that hold spooky set pieces.
-Far more effort and planning then previous levels.
Cons
-Shooting is still not fun due to animations getting restarted when you shoot as things are dying.
-I didn't want to go into some of the side rooms because I didn't want to accidently break the game again and have to start over.
-The ending is kind of bad and makes no sense at all.

Overall Opinion
Even though this game is now actually playable I still wouldn't recommend paying for it. It's currently at a pre-alpha state and $10 is a huge rip off. It's not what I'd call fun" and still needs a ton of work. It's also really unoptimized so expect slowdowns like crazy in some spots. Level transitions are terrible as well and in some instances I wasn't sure if I was going to the next level or if the game froze on me.

That being said
date: the dev is going in the right direction with it and I'm really happy to see regular updates. I either died or got to the end of the game (I went down the hallway to the right) so I can't comment on if there's anything past level 4 as of yet. I'm putting it down as recommended only because it looks like Panzer Gaming Studios is trying to turn it into something and because I support indi devs."

Early Access Review

Ok first off. I don't know what the big deal is. The game is in early access. These developers are using the money for funding. There is a clear warning on the store page what the shape of the game is in.

Now I am amazed at how well the developers handled Jim Sterlings video's and counter acted on both with his own. I thought it was great, and it really shows especially yesterdays update that this guy or guys or girls or who ever means business. I wasn't to sure at first a few days ago, but with that new update am hooked. I don't care what anyone else thinks you guys have my support. I am recommending this game when I go to ID Tech camp next week which is a bunch of gamers.

Now let me tell you what I really love. You never know what to expect each time you play this game, and am not saying this in a bad way at all. But one day it could look the same and play the same and the next day BAM major improvement. Honestly from now till the game is out am willing to bet its going to be a whole new game more than a few times around the block until the game is fully finished and released.

HIGHLY recommend this game.
